alert.note: Alert for Clark; Greene (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN CLARK AND NORTHEASTERN GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM EDT... At 130 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Cedarville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Cedarville, South Charleston, Harmony, Lisbon, South Vienna, Clifton, Pitchin, Plattsburg and Selma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
